text: (X-Post from <#C67910KEH|general>) Would anyone here who is proficient with RCall be willing to help me out at some point with a side project I am working on? I am very new to the RCall and R ecosystems and would much benefit from help here with it! Thanks. :slightly_smiling_face: To be a bit more specific, more just looking for pointers when trying to interop some of my work in R with Julia - I keep running into errors where I am not sure if that is me not knowing about the ecosystem, or legitimate package issues.

elements.text: ) Would anyone here who is proficient with RCall be willing to help me out at some point with a side project I am working on? I am very new to the RCall and R ecosystems and would much benefit from help here with it! Thanks.

To be a bit more specific, more just looking for pointers when trying to interop some of my work in R with Julia - I keep running into errors where I am not sure if that is me not knowing about the ecosystem, or legitimate package issues.

text: I find RCall very easy to reason about - just fire up an RStudio session and run whatever code you want to run (when having to move data from Julia just use CSV), and everything should run the same way in RCall. If it doesn't it might well be a bug (unless you're in Pluto, where RCall like other macro based packages doesn't really work)

elements.text: I find RCall very easy to reason about - just fire up an RStudio session and run whatever code you want to run (when having to move data from Julia just use CSV), and everything should run the same way in RCall. If it doesn't it might well be a bug (unless you're in Pluto, where RCall like other macro based packages doesn't really work)

text: I've also got some experience and would be happy to help, though I find R error messages inscrutable

elements.text: I've also got some experience and would be happy to help, though I find R error messages inscrutable

text: post it her. i will try my best

elements.text: post it her. i will try my best

text:
Hey <@U7JQGPGCQ>, <@U8JP5B9T2>, and <@U6GD6JN2K> - you guys are the bomb dot com! Thanks for being willing to help out! I was able to figure out most of my problem last night but I still get an odd error here or there. I am somewhat happy with my current workarounds, but would be happy to know if you guys may know a fix for it. Here is a detailed explanation of the issues I am running into: <https://github.com/JuliaInterop/RCall.jl/issues/408>

Furthermore, if you want the installation instructions for the packages I am using, the R code, and the Julia-R code (.jlr?) I am happy to share. Thanks guys!
